intro: Miconia tocachensis, commonly known as the Tocantins miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its large, showy leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments, often in lowland rainforests. It has a woody stem and can reach heights of up to 5 meters, making it a significant component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
